measured_by: mid-frontal theta oscillations (4–7 Hz) recorded with scalp EEG
justification: “Human EEG studies have put forth mid-frontal theta oscillations (MFT, 4-7 Hz) as a potential indicator signalling the need for cognitive control … Increased MFT activity has been consistently observed in various scenarios that necessitate heightened cognitive control.”
